result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacey L Castle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Restitution of $439.49 was prepaid to the District Attorney's office.

No Contact with Yolanda G. 
**Defendant is ordered to move and is not to reside within 2 miles of the victim. (To work with agent). 
Maintain full time employment and/or school combination. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stacey L Castle

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on December 4, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stacey L Castle in court with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agent Sue Carris appears in person from probation and parole.  Attorney Redetzke advises the court the defendant has not moved in but is expected to move in late afternoon of November 7, 2017.  Agent Carris to file a written confirmation with the court the defendant has moved in and proposed order extending probation.  If confirmation provided to the court the December 4, 2017 hearing will be removed form the courts calendar. The court will be extending probation for 18 months from the date of the move in.  Attorney Redetzke requests the court allow the defendant to petition the court to discharge from probation after 12 months.  The court would consider the request when filed.  Review hearing scheduled for December 4, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on November 3, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Filed by Attorney Redetzke.
Letter to the defendant from the landlord regarding moving in date.

Defendant Stacey L Castle in court with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent Sue Karris appears in person.  Attorney Redetzke advises the court that the Defendant was not able to move into the new residence due to a fire but is scheduled to move in on November 1, 2017.  The Court schedules the case for a hearing on 11/3/17 to confirm the defendant has moved.  Hearing scheduled for November 3, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on October 18, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Redetzke advises the Court the Defendant is scheduled to move in on October 15, 2017.    The Court schedules the case for a hearing to confirm the Defendant has moved in.  Hearing scheduled for October 18, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 5/20/17.

Defendant Stacey L Castle in court with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent Karras appears in person.  The Court calls the case to address the status of the Defendant's change of residence.   The Defendant has paid a deposit on a new residence, is expected to sign the contract in the new few days and is scheduled to move in on May 15, 2017. Agent Karras has no concerns and the new address complies with probation. The Victim addresses the Court.   The Defendant has until the end of the June to be completely out of her current residence.  The Court takes no other action at this time.
Review hearing on April 3, 2017 at 10:30 am.
filed by the victim regarding motion for modification of conditions of probation.

Defendant Stacey L Castle in court with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agent Sue Karras appears from probation and parole.  The Court grants Attorney Redetzke's motion for all correspondence to be sealed and all correspondence filed by Attorney Redetzke regarding J.C. is ordered sealed by the Court.     Attorney Redetzke addresses the Court.  Attorney Will takes no position but does file a letter form the victim and requests the Court take the Victim into consideration when rendering a decision on the motion.  The Court denies the motion with prejudice and orders the Defendant must comply with the Court's judgment and the Defendant must move within 45 days.    The Court schedules the case for a review hearing in 60 days.  Review hearing scheduled for April 3, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Conditions of Probation filed by Atty Redetzke.

Defendant Stacey L Castle in court with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court calls the case to address the Department of Corrections letter filed by 1/9/17.     Attorney Redetzke advises the Court he would like to file a motion to amend the conditions of probation.  Attorney Woller advises the Court he is not taking a position at this time.  Attorney Redetzke to file the motion by 1/31/17 and the State to file a response by close of business on Wednesday, February 1, 2017.  Motion hearing scheduled for February 2, 2017 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Stacey L Castle in court.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant indicates she is not eligible for the Public Defender and provides proof to the Court.  Defendant requests court appointed counsel.  Court grants the appointment of counsel.  Defendant to reimburse the county at the rate of $50.00 per month with the first payment due today and the last day of each month.   Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing at 11-30-2015 10:00 am
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Not to use or possess any personal identification of any other individuals.

Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.
